intro: Rapanea macrophylla var. menaziensis, commonly known as the Menazan mahogany, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a deep green color. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
